required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Hip Replacement on Lower Extremity Hemodynamics in Crowe IV Hip Dysplasia Patient
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Hip Replacement (Subtrochanteric Osteotomy vs. Non-osteotomy) on Lower Extremity Hemodynamics in Crowe IV Hip Dysplasia Patient

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Explore the influence of hip replacement on lower extremity hemodynamics in Crowe Ⅳ hip dysplasia patient.

detailed_description.textblock: Changes of limb length after total hip replacement is common, especially for Crowe Ⅳ hip dysplasia patient. Such change potentially increases tension of vessel and influence lower extremity hemodynamics. Till now, little is known in this area.

primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative, 1 week, 6 weeks, 12 weeks, 24 weeks and 1 year after the surgery.
primary_outcome.description: change of hip harris score scale from baseline(preoperative) to 1 year after surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative, 1 week, 6 weeks, 12 weeks, 24 weeks and 1 year after the surgery.
primary_outcome.description: change of Leg Length from baseline(preoperative) to 1 year after surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week, 12 weeks, 24 weeks and 1 year after the surgery.
primary_outcome.description: change of Radiographic Results from 1 week after surger to 1 year after surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative, 1 week, 12 weeks after the surgery.
primary_outcome.description: change of vascular diameter and vascular cross-sectional from baseline(preoperative) to 1 year after surgery baseline(preoperative) to 12 weeks after surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative, 1 week, 6 weeks, 12 weeks, 24 weeks and 1 year after the surgery.
primary_outcome.description: change of systolic peak velocity, end-diastolic velocity, pulsation index, resistance index and blood flow from baseline(preoperative) to 1 year after surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative, 1 week, 6 weeks, 12 weeks, 24 weeks and 1 year after the surgery.
primary_outcome.description: change of blood viscosity from baseline(preoperative) to 1 year after surgery.

arm_group.arm_group_label: total hip replacement with subtrochanteral osteotomy
arm_group.description: subtrochanteral osteotomy is applied during total hip replacement

arm_group.arm_group_label: total hip replacement with no osteotomy
arm_group.description: no osteotomy is applied during total hip replacement.

intervention.intervention_name: total hip replacement with subtrochanteral osteotomy
intervention.description: applying subtrochanteral osteotomy during the operation to release the tension of vessels and nerve
intervention.arm_group_label: total hip replacement with subtrochanteral osteotomy

intervention.intervention_name: total hip replacement with no osteotomy
intervention.arm_group_label: total hip replacement with no osteotomy

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd affiliated hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
